name: Viva La Vino Wine Festival: Bangalore Edition
description: Viva La Vino – Bangalore EditionGet ready, Bangalore – after a smashing debut last year, India's coolest wine festival is back in your city with a bigger, bolder and even more fun Season 2! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari and Devati Mallick, VLV is the first-of-its-kind, a super-fun, laid-back festival with great wines + vibes, while building a wine culture that’s playful, welcoming, and totally unforgettable. Experience an evening of tasting wines with old and new wine friends in a full-on festival setting. Trust us, we will have you falling in love with the wine life all over again!What's in store this year:90+ wines from around the world: Sip, swirl, and savour a stunning lineup of international and Indian wines at your own pace. Discover new favourites, revisit classics, or surprise yourself with something unexpected. All wine tastings are included in your festival ticket.Artisan cheese: Your ticket includes a dreamy artisan cheese cup for one, so you can sip and snack at the same time. Want more? Shop extra platters and also take home your cheesy favourites.Craft chocolate: Meet India’s finest craft chocolate producers and shop their gourmet range to sweeten your evening. Wine, cheese, and chocolate are always a good idea!Taste + buy: Loved a wine? Don’t just dream about it—take it home that very night with special festival-only bottle prices.Exclusive masterclass: Get a masterclass ticket for a guided tasting of 4 premium wines not available at the main fest. A rare chance to dive deep with a cool sommelier, 25 seats only!Groovy music + poolside vibes: VLV Bangalore takes over the stunning poolside at JW Marriott Bengaluru. Their resident DJ will be spinning a banging set to keep the vibes flowing all evening.Live food stations: Indulge in mouthwatering bites from live stations curated by JW’s chefs, available to purchase on-site.Last year was a hot sell-out, and this year promises to be even bigger. Bring a friend, your partner, a whole gang of wine buddies, or come solo and find your tribe here. Just don’t miss it. See you there?

location.address: 24/1, Vittal Mallya Rd, KG Halli, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Viva La Vino
organizer.description: Welcome to VLV – the ultimate wine festival! Co-curated by Sommeliers Gargi Kothari (Magic Cellars) and Devati Mallick (Drink With D), VLV travels across 8 cities in its season 2 this year, celebrating wine, culture, and community. Join us for the best wines, fun vibes, and unforgettable memories..

name: Whose Mic Is It Anyways?  Two Shots & One Open Mic
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Pravāha: a table of rivers
description: Pravāha: a table of riversHost: Pinch of South | Venue: Bangalore Creative Circus | In collaboration with Understanding our Backyard, supported by Mycelium Ecology | On UrbanautNamaskaram,The rivers of the Western Ghats have long nourished fields, kitchens and rituals. Pravaha (meaning flow) is an immersive evening that brings these rivers to life through performance, ecology, and food.From 1 PM — Explore Understanding Our Backyard, an initiative connecting people with local ecologies – Free for everyonePravāha6:30 PM — Experience a dance and music performance inspired by the rivers of the Western Ghats.Dinner follows — A river-inspired multi-course menu celebrating the Krishna, Tungabhadra, Periyar, and Kaveri basins. - Pre-Booking RequiredVeg Dinner and a Choice of Non-Veg to add to your meal. Sample highlights: Avarekalu Tartlet, Pathrode Fingers, Miriyala Kodi, Royyala Iguru, Elaneer Payasam.Pravaha is more than a meal; it is an evening of belonging, where rivers flow through taste, story, and culture.Thank you,Key Info at a GlanceVenue: Bangalore Creative Circus, BengaluruUnderstanding Our Backyard from 1 PM – Free EntryPerformance at 6:30 PM, followed by dinner – Ticketed25 guests only for the intimate dining experienceTickets: Veg Dinner ₹2,499 | Child (6–12 yrs) ₹1,499 | Non-Veg Upgrade +₹300Accessibility: Wheelchair accessible venueTakeaway: Bring containers if you’d like to take leftoversPhotography: Event will be photographed; let us know if you prefer not to be featuredContact: hello@pinchofsouth.in | +91 86607 62512

name: Spark Your Product Management Journey!
description: Spark Your Product Management Journey!Get ready for an exciting event tailored for both technical and non-technical product managers! Join us as we explore essential topics that will enhance your skills and knowledge:1. Transform Stories, Not Timelines s: Learn how to create compelling narratives that highlight the true purpose and value behind your roadmaps.2. Align Early, Align Often: Discover the secrets to identifying key stakeholders and establishing effective communication rhythms that foster collaboration.3. Plan for Risk Like a Pro: Equip yourself with strategies to anticipate challenges and develop proven plans to address them proactively.4. From User Story to API Design: Embrace the innovative API-first design approach that your projects have been waiting for!5. Improve Stakeholder Engagement: Find new ways to engage stakeholders and make your product stand out. Join us for this engaging experience, and together, let's revolutionize the way we think about product management!About the host- Hi, I am Anu Sharma, an innovative IT professional with a passion for storytelling and technology. With over 15 years of experience as a technology and product leader, I also work as a writer, speaker, and blogger, sharing insights from my background in products, technology, responsible AI, sustainability, user experience (UX), and program managementMy goal is to empower others through daily learning experiences. As a lifelong learner, I thrive on connecting ideas and inspiring meaningful discussions.

name: 💌 Letters to Strangers
description: A pause in a world that rarely stops.This isn’t your usual Saturday plan. It’s a cozy circle of strangers who come together to write, reflect, and connect not through bios or small talk, but through handwritten letters. Expect an atmosphere that’s warm, quiet, and welcoming. You’ll be gently guided with prompts, no pressure, just presence.  As you write to someone you don’t know, and in the process, perhaps discover something about yourself.Whether you're an introvert, a deep feeler, or someone simply looking to slow down, this space is for you. Nothing performative. No judgment. Just words, honesty, and maybe a new connection or two.✨ Come as you are. 📝 Write what you didn’t know you needed to say. 💌 Leave with something you didn’t expect to find.Join us — let’s create something beautiful together.

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no one taking selfies, and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter! Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be using our phones for social media during the event; instead, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, iPads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours.

name: The Power of Stillness: Yin Yoga for Body & Mind
description: ✨ If your yoga journey has always been about movement, strength, and flow—this is your chance to pause and explore the other side of practice.Join us for a 90-minute Yin Yoga workshop that takes you beyond the physical workout into the realm of stillness and restoration. You’ll learn the philosophy behind yin, understand its unique benefits, and immerse yourself in a guided sequence of long-held postures designed to gently stretch connective tissues, release hidden tension, and calm an overworked nervous system.Yin yoga nourishes joint health, improves flexibility, enhances mobility, and, most importantly, teaches us to find comfort within discomfort. It’s a practice of presence, patience, and surrender—a balance to the fast pace of daily life.This workshop is perfect for anyone curious about slowing down, cultivating resilience, and discovering how stillness can be as transformative as movement. 🌙About the teacher: Yashaswini is a yoga teacher trained in Hatha, Vinyasa, Yin, Prenatal & Postnatal Yoga, Aerial Yoga, and Sound Meditation. She sees yoga as a practice of both movement and inner connection. Her classes bring together strength, stillness, and mindful awareness, offering an accessible space for students to explore their bodies, breath, and presence with curiosity and ease.Check out her work here: @yoga_with_yashaswini

name: Unboxing Patriarchy - A Conversation Circle
description: Unboxing Patriarchy: A Conversation CircleWhy Join?Patriarchal norms shape us all quietly - from men feeling pressure to “stay tough” to women battling self-doubt. This circle invites open, respectful dialogue where you can:Gain clarity – Notice how patriarchal norms influence choices, self-perception, and relationships, and start to see the invisible patterns that guide daily life.Find your voice – Share personal experiences you may not have spoken aloud before. This space values honesty and vulnerability over expertise.Build empathy – Listen to stories across gendered experiences, discovering both the constraints and pressures we all face. Greater understanding helps break down stereotypes.Strengthen connections – Learn ways to bring more respect, equity, and freedom into friendships, partnerships, parenting, and community life. Together, we can begin shifting cycles that no longer serve us.Common Concerns everyone has -“Isn’t this man-bashing?” -  No. The circle is about examining a system we all inherit—not blaming individuals.“I’m not political.” -  Patriarchy isn’t just politics; it shapes everyday realities like pay, emotional expression, dating, and family roles.“I don’t know enough.” -  Perfect. No expertise needed—your lived experience is the most valuable contribution.In short: This circle is an act of curiosity and courage. By exploring patriarchy together, we expand freedom and possibility—for everyone.All are welcome—no expertise required. Just bring openness.

description: What makes a good cup of coffee? Come to our roastery to find your answer.Curious about what really makes a good cup — beyond Instagram vibes and Pinterest-y mugs? name: Queer Cuddle Salon
description: Quick InfoWhen: Sun, 14th Sept, 5 pm - 10 pm ISTWhere: Koramangala, Bengaluru (exact location shared after registration)Format: OpenWho can Join : LGBTQIA+ solo, partneredWhat to Know: No Prior Knowledge NeededWhat to Bring: See BelowQuestions? Email us at sillyhands.shibari@gmail.comWelcome to Queer Cuddle Salon!Silly Hands Shibari is hosting an evening for LGBTQIA+ folks to pause, rest and gently explore platonic or sensual intimacy in an affirming space. We’re opening this space to take a break from the burning world, chronic pain and life in general to engage in consensual touching, cuddles and soft kink…and ofcourse, to let people eat cake. Our cozy little house is open all evening for you to drop by, meet and relax amongst other queer people. There will be dedicated areas for cuddling and enjoying touch. You can give or get a massage. Engage in soft, slow kink (think biting, playing footsie, rope play, sensory play, etc) Or you can sit and watch. Draw or colour. No pressure. At all. The Kitchen is reserved for water breaks, coffee, tea and snacks, to chat. It is a no-play zone and free from h*rny vibes.And for the first time, we’re exploring a concept called “Sweet Carolina”, a human platter centerpiece aka YOU. What does that mean?For the adventurous, exhibitionist folks, an optional “living platter” table invites volunteers (opt-in only) to recline on the dining table and be decorated with cake, fruit, candy or syrup that is artfully placed for others to graze, eat from. All our events hold consent at the top of our practice and will continue to be our responsibility as facilitator and yours as an attendee to negotiate your terms before engaging. This is not a s*x or a play party but a playful community event at the intersection of queerness & kink. We’re not allowing n*dity or g3nital play. Every ticket allows you + one buddy to attend the event. (You can bring you may bring a friend, partner, or chosen family member)More Info:The doors open at 5 pm sharp and stays open until 8 pm. Entry will not be allowed post 8 pm.At 5:30 we will have a round of introductions to those who are new to the space and others. As well as the rules, space and event. What to Bring:Yourself, Your BuddyA pair of comfy clothes to change into.Fav. Blanket A towel, if things get messy.Dress Code: Soft and Cozy (Loungewear, Leggings, Pajamas, Boxers, Hoodies…)

name: Shake & Flow : Somatic Release Movement Class
description: Shake the Dust isn’t just another fitness class—it’s HIIT but deep. It’s a somatic release class to shift your energy in motion, rest & release. Expect dancing, shaking, tapping, some yoga and embodied Pilates too with a curated soundscape to take you on a journey. More than movement, this is medicine for your soul—a space to meet yourself in every form: wild, raw, true, free, vulnerable, strong, and soft. Drop the weight of stress, ego, and expectation. Come move, breathe, and release. Feel the shift. Shake the dust.About your FacilitatorCookie is a certified yoga teacher (YTT 500) and trained in Shake the Dust in Sweden. Shake the Dust is a transformative and embodied practice of the body - heart - mind.The practice she will guide you through includes shaking, tapping, dancing, free movement embodied yoga, some Pilates too, somatics and body weight training, not to mention a kick-ass curated playlist. This class is designed for anyone and will deliver a cathartic release, a great workout, sweat and a strong, resilient body. Guiding us back to who we truly are.

name: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop
description: Basic Pencil Sketching Workshop - This isn’t just about sketching — it’s about slowing down, focusing your mind, and surprising yourself with what you can create.If you can hold a pencil, you can start here.Why This Event? - Always wanted to sketch but didn’t know where to begin?This workshop is designed for people who think they "can’t draw" — no experience needed. You'll learn the fundamentals of pencil sketching in a supportive, beginner-friendly space, with step-by-step guidance throughout.Whether it’s your first time sketching or you’re just looking to restart an old hobby, this session will help you understand the basics — and walk away with your own finished portrait.Duration : 3 hours (180–190 minutes)Enough time to learn, practice, and complete your first portrait with support.All basic art supplies will be provided during the session: Pencil set, Sharpener, Eraser, Blending tools, 4 sheets of sketching paperJust bring yourself — we’ll take care of the rest.What You’ll Learn & Take Away:Basics of pencil shading & stroke controlScience behind smooth blendingTools & techniques to create contrast and highlightsOne complete basic pencil portrait (made by you)Confidence to continue sketching at homeWho Can Join : Absolute beginners - Anyone aged 12 to 75 years- No prior drawing experience neededAbout the Host : Bharani Elangovan is a self-taught artist with 9+ years of experience in pencil sketching and hyperrealistic art. With a calm and clear teaching style, Bharani focuses on helping beginners understand why each technique works — making sketching approachable and enjoyable for everyone.

name: Japanese Film Screening - Floating Weeds
description: Floating Weeds (1959)By Yasujiro Ozu / 119 mins / Japanese with eng subsOne of six sublime color masterworks that Yasujiro Ozu produced late in his career, the director’s second filming of his own 1934 silent triumph A Story of Floating Weeds represents the mature flowering of his style. Harnessing the full expressive potential of color, sound, music, and his exquisite compositional sense, he brings new depths of bittersweet feeling—tinged with an aging artist’s melancholic nostalgia—as well as a new air of expansiveness, to a story with enduring resonance.

name: In Her Interest by Zerodha
description: Women have a complicated relationship with money.And it starts early.Many families shield their daughters from anything related to ‘finance’, but this well-meaning protection ends up being a disservice. When these young women step into the real world, they lack the confidence to make financial decisions - not because they’re incapable, but because they were never given information on budgeting, savings, and investments.Later in life, many continue to rely on their partners for investment decisions. This dependency on others will only stop when they have the right information and toolkit to take back control.That’s where we come in.After two 'In Her Interest' pilots, we've realised what women need is a safe, private space to talk money - where no question is too small or too basic.In our 5th In Her Interest session on September 20th in Bangalore, we will focus on two topics:How to create and build passive income and how to save for your retirement.The session is at the Samagata Foundation, on St. Mark's Road, Bangalore.Sushmitha Shetty - Home maker and trader who makes 60k as passive incomeDr. Sagneet Kaur - Financial Behaviour Scientist, PGIM - Asset Management, with a focus on retirement.The key areas we cover are:The foundations of incomeWhy passive income matters, especially for women?Case study of a personal story on how the speaker built and grew passive income.How to start looking for passive income?How can your hobby make money and drive financial freedom?How can your social network help you earn?Starting small, the importance of consistency, and how to scale.How to achieve a happy and fulfilling retirement?Worksheets to get you started on both topicsSession goalsSimplify money conceptsBust common financial mythsBuild your confidence in making financial decisionsNo jargon, just real talk.Note: Each session is theme-based. This session is about 'Creating and Building Passive Income and Saving for Retirement' - we are not talking stocks and shares.

name: 🍄✨Mushroom Yoga Brunch with Chef Sejal
description: The Mushroom Brunch is a collaborative weekend experience that blends yoga, food, coffee, and fungi culture. Designed as an intimate gathering, it celebrates mushrooms not only as nourishment but as a bridge between wellness, flavor, and community.🍄 The ConceptThis brunch brings together four collaborators—Nuvedo, Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Chef Sejal, and Lisha Sinha, to create a flow where participants can move, learn, taste, and connect. From yoga to mushroom harvesting, live cooking to coffee and conversation, the event is about exploring how mushrooms enrich our lives in unexpected ways.✨ FacilitatorsNuvedo – India’s functional mushroom brand, cultivating trust, transparency, and fungi-based wellness. Learn more: www.nuvedo.comMaverick & Farmer – One of India’s few true farm-to-cup coffee brands. With a 140-acre estate in Coorg and a roastery in Bangalore, they produce experimental, award-winning single-estate coffees shipped across India and abroad. Their team, with over a decade of roasting experience, helped pioneer India’s fourth wave of coffee. Learn more: https://www.maverickandfarmer.com/ Chef Sejal Agrawal – A vegan, plant-based chef trained at The Vegan School, Goa. Currently a chef at C+C, she also takes on private chef projects, crafting nourishing meals that often give classic non-vegan dishes a vibrant, plant-based twist. Her passion lies in Asian flavors, food R&D, and showing how fun and delicious plant-based eating can be. https://www.instagram.com/chef.sejal/ Lisha Sinha – A yoga teacher with over 500 hours of training in Ashtanga, Vinyasa, and Hatha yoga. Lisha integrates breathwork, meditation, and sound in her sessions, inspired by teachers like B.K.S. Iyengar and Sharath Jois. She believes yoga is about presence and resilience, and through her platform Wellness Loop, she creates mindful wellness experiences for individuals and corporates . https://www.instagram.com/lishasinha/ 📌 Where: Maverick & Farmer Coffee, Gate #3, Gangadhar Chetty Rd, Halasuru, Rukmani Colony, Sivanchetti Gardens, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042 ( https://maps.app.goo.gl/fkCEsqACpZJ3TMEo9 )📆 Date: September 21st, 2025⌚ Time: 9:00 AM - 12:00 PM💰 Cost: INR 1800 + GST (includes all activities and refreshments)LIMITED SEATS AVAILABLE — Book now to secure your spot!🔗 REGISTER HERE: https://rzp.io/rzp/Z5kmeRUj 🗓️ Schedule9:00 AM – Introduction to functional mushrooms with Nuvedo9:30 AM – Vinyasa Flow with Lisha Sinha10:30 AM – Mushroom Brunch• Live Lion’s Mane mushroom harvest by participants• Live Cooking with Chef Sejal• Mushroom-forward vegan menu• Lion’s Mane Mushroom Coffee with Maverick & Farmer11:30 AM – Closing circle & reflectionsSeats are limited to 20 participants. Reserve your spot to be part of this mindful, flavorful Sunday gathering.With love and spores,Nuvedo x Maverick & Farmer Coffee with Chef Sejal & Lisha Sinha

This workshop sparks creativity, problem-solving, and collaboration, while nurturing an early awareness of sustainability by demonstrating how ordinary recyclables can be transformed into extraordinary possibilities.

name: Pint of View (Lecture 4): Much Ado About Drawing
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where classroom-styled lectures meet craft cocktails in pubs and bars.In our fourth lecture, we’re bringing you Kaustubh Khare, a semiotician, educator, and believer that everyone can draw. This one’s special: part lecture, part workshop on visual thinking. Kaustubh will show how doodling and drawing can transform into tools for clarity, creativity, and sharper articulation, and even help ideas stick in memory for longer. All of this, over Geist beer on tap at Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar.What to Expect:A 60-minute lecture-workshop on visual thinking and its everyday applications15–20 minutes of interactive Q&AOne Geist beer on tap included with your ticketA lively mixer to share what you drew, see how others mapped their insights, and take home a new perspectiveThis isn’t an art class or a drawing workshop. Through Kaustubh’s lived experience, we’ll explore the science of visual thinking and its real-world uses: from mind maps and graphs to teaching tools and even investor pitch decks. All in the chill vibe of a pub lecture, over a drink and some grub.Event Details:📅 Sunday, 21st September | 4 PM – 6 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar🎫 Limited to 60 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 ticketsAbout the LecturerKaustubh Khare believes that everyone can draw and that drawing is less about talent and more about how we think. His lecture-workshops transform doodling into a powerful tool for clarity, creativity, and collaboration. He has worked with governments, universities, startups, and nonprofits on diverse projects, including designing visual pedagogical tools now used by over half a million government school teachers in Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. A graduate of IIT Kharagpur, Ashoka University, and the University of Tartu, he is currently exploring how India's heritage can be brought alive through visual storytelling.About Pint of ViewInspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S., Pint of View brings this format to India for the first time. It’s where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand, walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Supper Club by Pepper and Lilly
description: Pepper and Lilly is a curated supper club where dining transforms into an intimate, immersive experience. For one evening, a home comes alive as a café, blending the warmth of personal hosting with the charm of a private dining space. Each gathering is crafted around unique themes, featuring thoughtfully designed menus, coastal inspirations, handcrafted desserts, and stories woven into every detail—from the table décor to the flavors on the plate.It’s not just about food—it’s about conversations, connections, and the joy of sharing a meal in an atmosphere that feels both exclusive and familiar. At Pepper and Lilly, every guest becomes part of the story, creating memories that linger long after the night ends.
